qas.question: What is a comon epithet of Apollo as a healer?
In classical times, what was Apollo's strong function in popular religion?
What is a word for "defent from evil?"

context: Some common epithets of Apollo as a healer are "<a0_0>paion<a0_0/>" (παιών, literally "healer" or "helper") "epikourios" (ἐπικουρώ, "help"), "oulios" (οὐλή, "healed wound", also a "scar" ) and "loimios" (λοιμός, "plague"). In classical times, his strong function in popular religion was to <a1_0>keep away evil,<a1_0/> and was therefore called "apotropaios" (ἀποτρέπω, "divert", "deter", "avert") and "<a2_0>alexikakos<a2_0/>" (from v. ἀλέξω + n. κακόν, "defend from evil"). In later writers, the word, usually spelled "Paean", becomes a mere epithet of Apollo in his capacity as a god of healing.
